symptoms: Dash cluster and warning lamps flicker with electrical smell near steering column.

root_cause_hypotheses.hypothesis: Aftermarket dash camera tapping improper fuse causing harness overheating
root_cause_hypotheses.evidence: Odor and flicker aligned with accessory install on shuttle fleet.

root_cause_hypotheses.hypothesis: Loose ground at body control module
root_cause_hypotheses.evidence: U0100 communication losses often linked to body grounds.

root_cause_hypotheses.hypothesis: Failing steering column clockspring shorting circuits
root_cause_hypotheses.evidence: Airbag lamp flash plus steering column smell, but symptoms intermittent.

most_likely_cause: Improper accessory wiring overheating BCM feed circuit.

recommended_actions.step: Disconnect aftermarket accessories and inspect fuse tap wiring
recommended_actions.why: Removes added load and reveals heat damage.

recommended_actions.step: Perform voltage drop test on BCM grounds under load
recommended_actions.why: Confirms integrity of critical grounds causing U0100.

recommended_actions.step: Inspect clockspring and column harness for melted insulation

safety_notes: Disconnect battery and wait 3 minutes before touching airbag circuits.
Do not operate vehicle until short is resolved.
warranty_or_tsb_refs: Ford SSM 50115 (accessory wiring causing BCM faults)
disclaimers: Vehicle should remain out of service until wiring passes insulation test.

confidence.assessment: Electrical data incomplete; accessory wiring highly suspect.

confidence_uplift_requirements: Thermal image of fuse panel during symptom
Voltage drop readings on BCM grounds

customer_readiness_check.short_reason: Must gather electrical measurements before clearance.
